00028 /* Includes ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00029 #include "ht32.h"
00030 #include "ht32_board.h"
00031 #include "ht32_board_config.h"

00046 /* Settings ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00047 
00048 /* Set DISABLE_DEBUG_PIN as 1 to disable SWD debug pins as input floating. It is meaningful for measure     */
00049 /* more accurate power consumption since those GPIOs are used as the debug port by default.                 */
00050 /* Refer to the readme.txt for how to re-download the code after SWD debug pin have been disabled.          */
00051 #define DISABLE_DEBUG_PIN       (0)
00052 
00053 /* Private variables ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00054 extern vu32 wTimingDelay;
00055 
00056 /* Private function prototypes -----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00057 void RTC_Configuration(void);
00058 void EXTI_Configuration(void);
00059 void SysTick_Configuration(void);
00060 void Delay(u32 nTime);
00061 
00062 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00063 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00064   * @brief  Main program.
00065   * @retval None
00066   * @note At this stage the microcontroller clock setting is already configured,
00067   *       this is done through SystemInit() function which is called from startup
00068   *       file (startup_ht32fxxxx.s) before branching to application main.
00069   *       To reconfigure the default setting of SystemInit() function, refer to
00070   *       system_ht32fxxxx.c file
00071   * @details The main program as following:
00072   *   - Initialize LEDs.
00073   *   - Configure RTC clock source and prescaler.
00074   *   - Configure EXTI channel used to wakeup Deep Sleep Mode 1.
00075   *   - Configure the SysTick to generate an interrupt per millisecond.
00076   *   - Turn on LED1.
00077   *   - Wait for pressing KEY1 to enter the infinite loop.
00078   *   - In the infinite loop:
00079   *     - Insert 0.5 second delay.
00080   *     - Check the KEY1 button.
00081   *     - Wait till RTC count occurs.
00082   *     - Compare Match in 3 second.
00083   *     - Turn off LED1.
00084   *     - Configure button EXTI Channel on low level.
00085   *     - Request to enter Deep Sleep mode 1 (The LDO in low power mode).
00086   *     - Turn on LED1 when the system has resumed from Deep Sleep mode 1.
00087   *
00088   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00089 int main(void)
00090 {
00091   /* Initialize LEDs                                                                                        */
00092   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED1);
00093   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED2);
00094   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED3);
00095 
00096   /* Configure RTC clock source and prescaler                                                               */
00097   RTC_Configuration();
00098 
00099   /* Configure EXTI channel (KEY1) used to wakeup Deep Sleep Mode 1                                         */
00100   EXTI_Configuration();
00101 
00102   /* Configure the SysTick to generate an interrupt per millisecond                                         */
00103   SysTick_Configuration();
00104 
00105   /* Turn on LED1                                                                                           */
00106   HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(HT_LED1);
00107 
00108   /* Set DISABLE_DEBUG_PIN as 1 to disable SWD debug pins as input floating. It is meaningful for measure   */
00109   /* more accurate power consumption since those GPIOs are used as the debug port by default.               */
00110   /* Refer to the readme.txt for how to re-download the code after SWD debug pin have been disabled.        */
00111 #if (DISABLE_DEBUG_PIN == 1)
00112   /* Configure debug port GPIO pins to input floating                                                       */
00113   {
00114   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00115   CKCUClock.Bit.PA         = 1;
00116   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00117   }
00118   AFIO_GPxConfig(GPIO_PA, AFIO_PIN_11 | AFIO_PIN_12 | AFIO_PIN_13, AFIO_FUN_GPIO);
00119   GPIO_PullResistorConfig(HT_GPIOA, GPIO_PIN_11 | GPIO_PIN_12 | GPIO_PIN_13, GPIO_PR_DISABLE);
00120 #endif
00121 
00122   /* Check KEY1 button. If pressed, enter the infinite loop                                                 */
00123   while (HT32F_DVB_PBGetState(BUTTON_KEY1) == 0x1);
00124 
00125   /* Infinite loop                                                                                          */
00126   while (1)
00127   {
00128     /* Insert 0.5 second delay                                                                              */
00129     Delay(500);
00130 
00131     /* Check the KEY1 button to prevent EXTI from waking the system up continuously.                        */
00132     while (HT32F_DVB_PBGetState(BUTTON_KEY1) == 0x0){};
00133 
00134     #if (EXAMPLE_RTC_LSE == 1)
00135     {
00136       u32 wRtcCounterTmp = 0;
00137       /* Wait till RTC count occurs                                                                         */
00138       wRtcCounterTmp = RTC_GetCounter();
00139       while (RTC_GetCounter() == wRtcCounterTmp);
00140 
00141       /* Compare Match in 3 second                                                                          */
00142       RTC_SetCompare(RTC_GetCounter()+ 3);
00143     }
00144     #endif
00145 
00146     /* Configure button EXTI Channel on low level                                                           */
00147     EXTI_WakeupEventConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, EXTI_WAKEUP_LOW_LEVEL, ENABLE);
00148 
00149     /* Turn off LED1                                                                                        */
00150     HT32F_DVB_LEDOff(HT_LED1);
00151     HT32F_DVB_LEDOff(HT_LED2);
00152     HT32F_DVB_LEDOff(HT_LED3);
00153 
00154     /* Request to enter Deep Sleep mode 1 (The LDO in low power mode)                                       */
00155     PWRCU_DeepSleep1(PWRCU_SLEEP_ENTRY_WFI);
00156 
00157     /* Turn on LED1 when the system has resumed from Deep Sleep mode 1                                      */
00158     HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(HT_LED1);
00159   }
00160 }
00161 
00162 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00163   * @brief  Configures the SysTick to generate an interrupt per millisecond.
00164   * @retval None
00165   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00166 void SysTick_Configuration(void)
00167 {
00168   /* Setup SysTick Timer for 1 msec interrupts                                                              */
00169   if (SysTick_Config(SystemCoreClock / 1000))
00170   {
00171     /* Capture error                                                                                        */
00172     while (1);
00173   }
00174   /* Set SysTick Priority to 3                                                                              */
00175   NVIC_SetPriority(SysTick_IRQn, 0x3);
00176 }
00177 
00178 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00179   * @brief  Configures EXTI channel used to wakeup Deep Sleep Mode 1.
00180   * @retval None
00181   * @details The EXTI configuration as following:
00182   *   - Enable the EXTI and AFIO Clock.
00183   *   - Configure KEY1 button pin as input floating.
00184   *   - Connect KEY1 Button EXTI Channel to KEY1 Button GPIO Pin.
00185   *   - Enable and set EXTI Event Wakeup interrupt to the lowest priority.
00186   *
00187   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00188 void EXTI_Configuration(void)
00189 {
00190   /* Enable the AFIO and button GPIO Clock                                                                  */
00191   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00192   CKCUClock.Bit.AFIO         = 1;
00193   CKCUClock.Bit.EXTI         = 1;
00194   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00195 
00196   /* Configure Button pin as input floating                                                                 */
00197   HT32F_DVB_PBInit(BUTTON_KEY1, BUTTON_MODE_GPIO);
00198 
00199   /* Connect Button EXTI Channel to Button GPIO Pin                                                         */
00200   AFIO_EXTISourceConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, KEY1_BUTTON_GPIO_ID);
00201 
00202   /* Enable and set EXTI Event Wakeup interrupt to the lowest priority                                      */
00203   NVIC_SetPriority(EVWUP_IRQn, 0xF);
00204   NVIC_EnableIRQ(EVWUP_IRQn);
00205   EXTI_WakeupEventIntConfig(ENABLE);
00206 }
00207 
00208 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00209   * @brief  Configures RTC clock source and prescaler.
00210   * @retval None
00211   * @details The RTC configuration as following:
00212   *   - Check the backup domain(RTC & PWRCU) is ready for access.
00213   *   - Reset Backup Domain.
00214   *   - Enable the LSE OSC and wait till LSE is ready.
00215   *   - Select the RTC Clock Source as LSE.
00216   *   - Set the RTC time base to 1 second.
00217   *   - Set Compare value.
00218   *   - Enable the RTC.
00219   *   - Enable the RTC Compare Match wakeup event.
00220   *
00221   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00222 void RTC_Configuration(void)
00223 {
00224 #if (EXAMPLE_RTC_LSE == 1)
00225   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00226   CKCUClock.Bit.BKP          = 1;
00227   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00228 
00229   #if (LIBCFG_NO_PWRCU_TEST_REG == 1)
00230   #else
00231   /* Check the backup domain(RTC & PWRCU) is ready for access                                               */
00232   if (PWRCU_CheckReadyAccessed() != PWRCU_OK)
00233   {
00234     while (1);
00235   }
00236   #endif
00237 
00238   /* Reset Backup Domain                                                                                    */
00239   PWRCU_DeInit();
00240 
00241   /* Enable the LSE OSC                                                                                     */
00242   RTC_LSESMConfig(RTC_LSESM_NORMAL);
00243   RTC_LSECmd(ENABLE);
00244   /* Wait till LSE is ready                                                                                 */
00245   while (CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus(CKCU_FLAG_LSERDY) == RESET);
00246 
00247   /* Select the RTC Clock Source as LSE                                                                     */
00248   RTC_ClockSourceConfig(RTC_SRC_LSE);
00249 
00250   /* Set the RTC time base to 1s                                                                            */
00251   RTC_SetPrescaler(RTC_RPRE_32768);
00252 
00253   /* Set Compare value                                                                                      */
00254   RTC_SetCompare(0xFFFFFFFF);
00255 
00256   /* Enable the RTC                                                                                         */
00257   RTC_Cmd(ENABLE);
00258 
00259   /* Enable the RTC Compare Match wakeup event                                                              */
00260   RTC_WakeupConfig(RTC_WAKEUP_CM, ENABLE);
00261 #endif
00262 }
00263 
00264 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00265   * @brief  Inserts a delay time.
00266   * @param  nTime: specifies the delay time length, in milliseconds.
00267   * @retval None
00268   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00269 void Delay(u32 nTime)
00270 {
00271   wTimingDelay = nTime;
00272 
00273   while (wTimingDelay != 0);
00274 
00275 }
00276 
00277 #if (HT32_LIB_DEBUG == 1)
00278 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00279   * @brief  Report both the error name of the source file and the source line number.
00280   * @param  filename: pointer to the source file name.
00281   * @param  uline: error line source number.
00282   * @retval None
00283   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00284 void assert_error(u8* filename, u32 uline)
00285 {
00286   /*
00287      This function is called by IP library that the invalid parameters has been passed to the library API.
00288      Debug message can be added here.
00289      Example: printf("Parameter Error: file %s on line %d\r\n", filename, uline);
00290   */
00291 
00292   while (1)
00293   {
00294   }
00295 }
00296 #endif
